content.description: Stand start the pleasant slab to the left of Drex.
content.location: This ascends the slab left of Drex.

content.description: Low sit start on the tall, blunt arête starting off marginal slopes.
content.location: Locate the split in the two boulders that faces the cell tower/road. This problem is the left arête on the larger boulder.

content.description: Stand or squat start the front up cool arete features. This is lower angle and more awkward than hard on nice rock.
content.location: This climbs the front of the smaller boulder with Shoot the Fair and Cringe Lord.

content.description:
Stand start the face just left of Shoot the Fair using the same arete. 

  The problem would much better if the other boulder wasn’t right at your back.
content.location: It is in the gap just left of Shoot the Fair.

content.description:
Climb the left arete and steep slab of the smaller boulder. 

  The stand goes at V2-V3, but the sit is the business. Use the obvious black flake for the your foot. Tricky beta gets you standing, and a hard slab move (crux) gets onto the face proper. This ascends beautiful rock.
content.location: It is on the fairly obvious, steep face and left arete of the smaller, broken off boulder. This faces the road.

content.description: Stand start the right-trending, slopey lip to a high topout.
content.location: Locate the split between the two boulders that faces the cell tower/road. This problem begins on two overhead slopey crimps about 8-10 feet left of the split.

content.description: Sit start with a good sloper and the crack. Crank up to the slot/crack, and enjoy the airy topout.
content.location: This is the crack system to the left of Edge of Reality.

content.description: Climb the right arete and face from the stand on easy but perfect rock.
content.location: This ascends the right arete on same face as Shoot the Fair.

content.description: Sit start with your left hand low on the slopey arête and your right hand on a lower undercling. Power up to a distant, bad sloper, lock off, slap up the left arête, reach better holds, and top out. A newly broken foothold makes this impossible problem barely possible.
content.location: This ascends the somewhat bald looking arête on the smaller boulder that faces away from the traffic circle.

content.description: This large split block has mostly easy climbs on it, but the face that faces the road has some harder stuff. It has excellent rock.
